company.name: Laboratory of Clinical and Developmental Studies at Teachers College, Columbia University

profile_positions.company: Laboratory of Clinical and Developmental Studies at Teachers College, Columbia University
profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
- Process 8-10 audio files weekly from interviews with adolescents with suicidality to aggregate data 
- Facilitate weekly coding of 150 transcripts from adolescents with suicidality in order to evaluate coherency of story using given prompts 
- Review 38 research articles for systematic review paper on the mediator, moderator, and predictors of suicidal intervention to produce a manuscript intended for publishing
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

company.name: Loss, Trauma, Emotion Lab at Teachers College, Columbia University

profile_positions.company: Loss, Trauma, Emotion Lab at Teachers College, Columbia University
profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
- Manage recruitment and 4 to 6 follow-up of participants from veteran and community samples 
- Oversee Qualtrics to check participants’ questionnaires and information on their mental well-being
- Train 1-3 new research assistants to prepare them for participants intakes
- Administer computerized emotional tasks and interviews to assess role of family dynamics and emotion regulation strategies in adolescents (aged 11-17) and their primary caregivers
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
KAVBA (Korean Advancement of Behavior Analysis) Children’s Center is the first CABAS® accredited site in Asia, located in Seoul, South Korea. KAVBA provides Early Intensive Behavioral Intervention (EIBI) utilizing curriculum/assessment tools such as C-PIRK(CABAS® International Curriculum and Inventory of Repertoires for Children from Preschool through Kindergarten), VBDA-R(Verbal Behavior Development Assessment-Revised), and KISSYC (Korean Inventory of Social Skills for Young Children). Communication, language, academic skills, play, self-management, and social skills are targeted areas for children ages 2-7. Based on verbal behavior levels of children, various group program services are provided. The ratio of teacher to children in all group programs is 1:1.

Responsibilities:
- Provide 32 hours of ABA treatment weekly to children with autism spectrum disorder aged between 4 to 6
- Develop an individualized treatment based on the CABAS model 
- Administer PEP-R
- Interact with children to improve their verbal and non-verbal communication
- Communicate between supervisors and colleagues for problem-solving
- Write monthly and interim reports for the child 
- DVBM project: observe each child's behavior and translate them into data for data collection
profile_positions.title: ABA Therapist

profile_positions.description:
Samsung Medical Center is one of the tertiary hospitals located in South Korea. The hospital has several departments, ranging from Psychiatry to Cancer Education Center where patients receive specialized treatments. It is also an institution for researchers in the fields of medicine, psychology, and psychiatry. 

Responsibilities:
- Administered clinical interviews to participants who are at risk of having depression  (MINI, MADRS, PDSS)
- Coded completed questionnaires
- Get research projects approved with IRB
-A research paper for publication on "Association of smartphone overuse with depression, anxiety, and other addictive behaviors: A nationwide community sample of Korean adults" (Psychiatry Research, first author, 2021)
- A review paper for publication on "A review of suicide risk assessment tools and their measured psychometric properties in Korea" (Frontiers in psychiatry, second author, 2021)
profile_positions.title: Assistant researcher at the Samsung Medical Center

profile_positions.description:
The Psychology faculty at the University of Amsterdam works on various research topics and papers within the psychology fields. One of the ongoing projects is conducting a meta-analysis on the topic of habituation in infants. 

Responsibilities:
- Select keywords and excluding words as search terms 
- Screen scientific articles
- Create a coding scheme
- Create a decision tree for inclusion and exclusion criteria
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Rexle Bookclub is a small academic school in Korea that aims to teach English to kindergarten and primary school children. Students get to practice their writing, reading, speaking skills with teachers through interactive activities with teachers in a small class. 

Responsibilities: 
- Support students' English and reading comprehension skills 
- Assign and mark their homework 
- Proofread the students' writing
profile_positions.title: English Teacher

profile_positions.description:
Little Ivy is a kindergarten located in Seoul. The school teaches kindergarteners (age of 5 to 6) all year round and runs an English program during the summer. The English program aims to help children practice not only their English skills, but also their creativity, reading, critical thinking skills. Teachers organize field trips, performances, art classes that are carried out in English. 

Responsibilities:  
- organize each class, field trips, interactive activities (cooking, performing arts) 
- improve students' conversational and reading comprehension skills
profile_positions.title: English Teacher Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description:
Student Delegate for the Clinical Developmental specialization
-organize student events 
-course evaluation with professors
-collect feedback from students

Korean Language Table is a student-led group at the University of Leiden who are majoring in Korean Studies. This group helps to exchange language and culture between South Korea and the Netherlands among students.  

Responsibilities
- Help international students majoring in Korean Studies at Leiden University to practice their Korean skills
- Exchange Korean Cultures and Dutch cultures
- Organize group session every week

Dreamteam at the University of Amsterdam Psychology department aims to help prospective psychology students through various school events. The group aims to inform the students as much as possible regarding the program. 

Responsibilities:
- Organize campus tours, open days, Student for a Day 
- Provide information sessions about admissions, curriculum, Dutch university system
- Hold Q & A sessions

Liberty in North Korea is an international nonprofit organization that aims to support North Korean refugees to achieve their freedom. The refugees need to escape China to reach safety but many refugees do not have enough resources to reach a safe country in Southeast Asia. The organization helps North Koreans escape a brutal regime through a 3,000-mile secret rescue route.

Responsibilities: 
- Raise awareness of the North Korean refugees and the reality in North Korea through awareness week, games, charity events
- Raised funds for charity events (eg. Valentine gram, bake sale)
- Organized weekly meetings 
- Assigned roles to charity members
- Worked on social media to raise awareness and promote events

High School Helpers was one of the extracurricular activities at ACS Cobham International School. High school students help elementary school students with their classwork and improve their English skills, including writing, reading comprehension, listening, and speaking. 

Responsibilities:
- Practice English academic skills with Korean ESL students to support their writing and speaking skills
- Translated instructions to students and their work to homeroom teachers to facilitate their learning in a second language
- Worked with parents and homeroom teachers to discuss the student's progress

Salama Charities is a private organization ran by Farida Mills-Gaman, a Kenyan and British National. The charity aims to alleviate some of the difficulties that children in Kenya are facing. Various fundraising events can help support education, physiotherapy treatment, and vocational training of children. The group held fundraising events by selling handmade crafts from Kenya and raise awareness among students at the high school. 

Responsibilities:

- Calculated the total estimated budget for the events 
- Calculated how much fund was raised
- Organized fundraising events

skills: Teaching English as a Second Language
